item.title: 五人在欧洲议会华为贿赂案调查中被起诉
item.description: 比利时检察院周二表示，它已指控五人涉嫌参与欧洲议会的贿赂调查，据称该调查与中国华为公司（HWT.UL）有关。【原文：The Belgian prosecutor's office said on Tuesday that it has charged five people in connection with a bribery investigation in the European Parliament allegedly linked to China's Huawei (HWT.UL).】

item.title: 黑客帝国》联合制片人 Village Roadshow 在破产后 "接受所有投标
item.description: 美国电影制片商 Village Roadshow Entertainment Group 在申请破产一天后的周二在法庭听证会上表示，对包括《黑客帝国》（The Matrix）、《十一罗汉》（Ocean's Eleven）和《小丑》（The Joker）等知名电影版权在内的电影资料库 "开放接受所有投标"。【原文：U.S. film producer Village Roadshow Entertainment Group is “open to all bids” for a film library that includes rights to well-known movies like The Matrix, Ocean’s Eleven, and The Joker, a company attorney said on Tuesday at a court hearing a day after filing for bankruptcy.】

item.title: 美联航客机在伤人事件发生前导航部件出现故障
item.description: 调查人员称，美国联合航空公司一架波音787喷气客机在1月24日从拉各斯飞往华盛顿的航班上，导航的两个关键部件发生故障，随后飞机突然发生意外移动，导致乘客受伤。【原文：A United Airlines Boeing 787 jetliner on a January 24 flight bound for Washington from Lagos suffered a failure of two key parts for navigation before a sudden unexpected aircraft movement led to passenger injuries, investigators said.】

item.title: 特朗普政策反复无常，股市下跌令一些人重新考虑退休计划
item.description: 54 岁的维克多-费特斯（Victor Fettes）将于下周五退休，这是他计划已久的退休生活。【原文：Victor Fettes, 54, is going ahead with his long-planned retirement next Friday.】

item.title: 大众汽车将出售最多 2.2% 的特拉通股份
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司周二表示，该公司打算出售商用车制造商Traton公司最多1100万股股份，相当于最多2.2%的股份，按周二收盘价计算，价值约3.91亿欧元（4.2787亿美元）。【原文：Volkswagen intends to sell up to 11 million shares in commercial vehicle manufacturer Traton , the German carmaker said on Tuesday, representing up to a 2.2% stake worth about 391 million euros ($427.87 million) at Tuesday's closing price.】

item.title: 通用汽车将使用英伟达人工智能芯片和软件实现车辆和工厂自动化
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）与英伟达公司（Nvidia）周二表示，通用汽车将使用英伟达的人工智能芯片和软件为其汽车开发自动驾驶汽车技术，并改善其工厂的工作流程。【原文：General Motors will use artificial intelligence chips and software from Nvidia to develop autonomous vehicle technology for its vehicles and improve workflow at its factories, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 谷歌将支付 2800 万美元解决偏袒白人和亚裔员工的指控
item.description: 谷歌同意支付 2800 万美元，以解决一起集体诉讼，该诉讼称谷歌偏袒白人和亚裔员工，向他们支付更高的薪酬，并将他们置于比其他员工更高的职业发展轨道上。【原文：Google agreed to pay $28 million to settle a class action lawsuit claiming that it favored white and Asian employees by paying them more and putting them on higher career tracks than other workers.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院驳回缺乏 "人类 "创作者的人工智能艺术作品的版权申请
item.description: 华盛顿特区联邦上诉法院周二确认，根据美国法律，人工智能在没有人类输入的情况下生成的艺术作品不能获得版权。【原文：A federal appeals court in Washington, D.C., on Tuesday affirmed that a work of art generated by artificial intelligence without human input cannot be copyrighted under U.S. law.】

item.title: 巴西推出更广泛的所得税免税计划，卢拉寻求重获民心
item.description: 巴西政府周二公布了一项承诺已久的计划，即对月收入不超过 5,000 雷亚尔（合 881.27 美元）的个人免征所得税，收入缺口将通过对高收入者以及汇往国外的利润和红利征收新税来弥补。【原文：Brazil's government on Tuesday unveiled a long-promised plan to exempt individuals earning up to 5,000 reais ($881.27) per month from income tax, with the revenue gap set to be covered by new levies on high earners and profits and dividends sent abroad.】

item.title: 美国从欧洲进口的常用药物清单
item.description: 广泛使用的处方药可能会卷入特朗普政府的关税贸易战和欧盟的报复行动。【原文：Widely used prescription medicines could get caught up in the Trump administration's tariff trade wars and EU retaliation.】

item.title: 美国称准备与中国和加拿大就世贸组织争端进行磋商
item.description: 世界贸易组织周二的文件显示，在中国和加拿大针对新关税提出贸易争端后，美国代表团告诉中国和加拿大，它已准备好在日内瓦与其官员进行商议。【原文：The U.S. mission told China and Canada it was ready to confer with its officials in Geneva after those two countries filed trade disputes in response to new tariffs, World Trade Organization documents showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国称准备与中国和加拿大就世贸组织争端进行磋商
item.description: 世界贸易组织周二的文件显示，在中国和加拿大针对新关税提出贸易争端后，美国代表团告诉中国和加拿大，它已准备好在日内瓦与其官员进行商议。【原文：The U.S. mission told China and Canada it was ready to confer with its officials in Geneva after those two countries filed trade disputes in response to new tariffs, World Trade Organization documents showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: Adobe 为在线营销工具推出人工智能代理
item.description: Adobe 周二表示，它正在推出人工智能 "代理"，品牌可以用它来帮助消费者浏览网站。【原文：Adobe on Tuesday said it is rolling out artificial intelligence "agents" that brands can use to help consumers navigate their websites.】

item.title: Adobe 为在线营销工具推出人工智能代理
item.description: Adobe 周二表示，它正在推出人工智能 "代理"，品牌可以用它来帮助消费者浏览网站。【原文：Adobe on Tuesday said it is rolling out artificial intelligence "agents" that brands can use to help consumers navigate their websites.】

item.title: 荷兰议会呼吁停止依赖美国软件
item.description: 荷兰议会周二通过了一系列动议，呼吁政府减少对美国软件公司的依赖，包括建立一个由荷兰控制的云服务平台。【原文：The Netherlands' parliament on Tuesday approved a series of motions calling on the government to reduce dependence on U.S. software companies, including by creating a cloud services platform that is under Dutch control.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰入股机器人制造商 Apptronik，在工厂测试机器人
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）正在试用由美国公司 Apptronik 制造的仿人机器人，以执行将部件移至生产线或进行质量检查等任务，这是最新一家在制造领域试用机器人的汽车制造商。【原文：Mercedes-Benz is trialling using humanoid robots made by U.S.-based company Apptronik for tasks such as moving components to the production line or carrying out quality checks, the latest automaker to experiment with robots in manufacturing.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰入股机器人制造商 Apptronik，在工厂测试机器人
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）正在试用由美国公司 Apptronik 制造的仿人机器人，以执行将部件移至生产线或进行质量检查等任务，这是最新一家在制造领域试用机器人的汽车制造商。【原文：Mercedes-Benz is trialling using humanoid robots made by U.S.-based company Apptronik for tasks such as moving components to the production line or carrying out quality checks, the latest automaker to experiment with robots in manufacturing.】

item.title: 维基媒体挑战印度的内容删除行为，警告将对言论自由产生寒蝉效应
item.description: 运营维基百科的维基媒体基金会要求印度最高法院撤销一项命令，该命令要求在线百科全书运营商撤下一个描述其与一家国内新闻社法律纠纷的页面。【原文：The Wikimedia Foundation, which runs Wikipedia, has asked India's Supreme Court to quash an order directing the online encyclopedia operator to take down a page describing its legal dispute with a domestic news agency.】

item.title: 前往孤星之州企业向得克萨斯州迁移
item.description: 越来越多的公司将总部迁往得克萨斯州，吸引他们的是较低的税率、商业友好型法规和不断增长的人才库。【原文：An increasing number of companies are relocating their headquarters to Texas, drawn by lower taxes, business-friendly regulations and a growing talent pool.】

item.title: 西门子工厂自动化业务将裁员 5,600 人
item.description: 德国工程公司西门子周二宣布，将从其旗舰数字工业业务中裁员 5600 人，并表示正在根据疲软的需求调整产能。【原文：Siemens will cut 5,600 jobs from its flagship digital industries business, the German engineering company announced on Tuesday, saying it was adjusting its production capacity in line with weak demand.】

item.title: 贝森特：各国可通过削减贸易壁垒避免特朗普 4 月份的关税措施
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周二表示，特朗普政府将于4月2日根据贸易伙伴国自身的税率、非关税贸易壁垒和其他因素向这些国家提出美国的关税税率建议--同时提供谈判机会，以避免 "关税壁垒"。【原文：The Trump administration on April 2 will give trading partner countries a proposed U.S. tariff rate based on their own rates, non-tariff trade barriers and other factors -- along with an opportunity to negotiate to avoid a "tariff wall," U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 商务部长寻求业界帮助，防止中国获得美国芯片
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周二表示，特朗普政府正在寻求企业和外国政府的帮助，以防止中国获得美国芯片，并重申他相信中国人工智能公司 DeepSeek 不当使用了美国芯片。【原文：Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Tuesday the Trump administration is seeking help from companies and foreign governments to prevent China from getting U.S. chips, and reiterated his belief Chinese AI company DeepSeek improperly used American chips.】

item.title: 梅洛尼质疑以欧盟关税回应美国关税的明智性
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）周二对议会说，欧盟需要务实，在与美国的关税问题上寻求共识，以避免贸易战。【原文：The European Union needs to be pragmatic and seek common ground on tariffs with the United States to avert a trade war, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni told parliament on Tuesday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商和科技行业敦促特朗普加快自动驾驶汽车的部署
item.description: 主要汽车制造商和科技团体周二呼吁特朗普政府采取措施，加快自动驾驶汽车的部署，并列举了一些监管障碍。【原文：Major automakers and tech groups on Tuesday called on the Trump administration to take steps to speed deployment of self-driving cars, citing a number of regulatory hurdles.】

item.title: 美国 2 月份制造业产出加速增长
item.description: 受机动车产量激增的提振，2 月份美国制造业生产增幅超过预期，但关税给刚刚开始的工厂复苏蒙上了阴影。【原文：U.S. manufacturing production increased more than expected in February, boosted by a surge in motor vehicle output, but tariffs are casting a shadow on the nascent factory recovery.】

item.title: 普京承诺为 "蔑视俄罗斯 "的西方企业提供艰难的回归之路
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京周二表示，不允许那些离开俄罗斯时 "悍然摔门而去 "的西方公司以小额资金回购他们退出的企业，也不允许他们填补当地企业的空缺。【原文：Western companies that "slammed the door defiantly" when they left Russia will not be allowed to buy back the businesses they quit for small amounts of money or fill niches that local businesses have taken, President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 利安德巴塞尔与 Covestro 将永久关闭荷兰工厂
item.description: 利安德巴塞尔（LyondellBasell）周二表示，该化工公司和 Covestro 公司已决定永久关闭位于荷兰 Maasvlakte 工厂的环氧丙烷苯乙烯和单体生产装置。【原文：LyondellBasell said on Tuesday the chemical firm and Covestro have decided to permanently close the Propylene Oxide Styrene and Monomer production unit at the Maasvlakte site in the Netherlands.】

item.title: 法航-荷航首席执行官表示，法航-荷航正在与欧罗巴航空公司就潜在入股事宜进行谈判
item.description: 法航荷航首席执行官本-史密斯（Ben Smith）周二告诉路透社，法航荷航正在洽谈入股西班牙欧罗巴航空公司（Air Europa），并希望将其在斯堪的纳维亚航空公司 SAS 的现有持股增至多数。【原文：Air France-KLM is in talks to take a stake in Spanish airline Air Europa and is looking to boost its existing holding in Scandinavian carrier SAS to a majority, CEO Ben Smith told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 过去十年最大的科技交易
item.description: Alphabet 周二表示，将以 320 亿美元的价格收购 Wiz，这是该公司最大的一笔交易，因为谷歌母公司将在网络安全领域加倍努力，以增强其在与亚马逊和微软的云计算竞争中的优势。【原文：Alphabet said on Tuesday it would buy Wiz for $32 billion in its biggest deal as the Google parent doubles down on cybersecurity to sharpen its edge in the cloud-computing race against Amazon.com and Microsoft.】

item.title: 2 月份美国进口价格稳中有升
item.description: 由于消费品成本上升，2 月份美国进口价格意外上涨，这对通胀前景不是一个好兆头。【原文：U.S. import prices unexpectedly rose in February amid higher costs for consumer goods, which does not bode well for the inflation outlook.】
